content.description: Stand with a high left hand sidepull and a right hand palming the face. From there, match on the sidepull, move up to its beefy section, adjust the feet, stick the lip, then traverse left along the lip, and mantel up onto the opening.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing aside from a bush behind the opening moves.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Above, just right of

Old Hat

.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a micro-edge right hand. From there, work up the arete, reach over to the opposing arete, reach the lip, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a rock behind the problem. It acts as a good spot if it's padded.
content.location: It climbs the west face of Above, the detached boulder section.

content.description: Stand start with a right hand edge and a left hand sidepull seam or sidepull crimp if you desire. From there, gain an edge at the lip, and make a formidable mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great. There is a rock just behind the problem though.
content.location:
It climbs the west face of Above, just left of

Old Hat

.

content.description: Stand start with a matched waist high edge. From there, climb the feature to reach an attentive mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the center west face of Above Boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on the obvious jug. From there, climb up through a series of edges, slopers, and pinches to reach a mindful mantel.
content.protection: It has a near perfect landing, but a pad or two would be useful.
content.location:
It climbs the east face of the cliff band near

Chance of Pity

.

content.description: Stand with a right hand on the arete and left hand on the face. From there, climb the short, featureless slab to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the separated boulder's slab along Above's west face.

content.description: Sit start from your choice of hold. From there, climb through sloping edges to a baseball-sloper, and mantel on top the boulder.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is flat and clear.
content.location: It climbs the east face of the Above Boulder. I guess the problem could be considered the middle-section of the cliff.
